name: pleach
content:

to twist branches together in a line of trees or a hedge (= a line of bushes planted very close together, especially along the edge of a garden, field, or road): At the top of the garden, box hedges and pleached arbours are laid out in traditional patterns. One of the workers cut his finger when plashing a hedge.
More examplesFewer examplesI planted a row of limes along the drive, intending to pleach them so they could filter the wind.We were taught such skills as pleaching a lime-tree.The large fields were divided by plashed hedges.
